Member Enumeration Documentation

enum uStreamLib::Logger::LoggerLevel
 

Logger levels. This levels are used as runtime filtering.

Enumeration values:
LEVEL_DEBUG  Debug level
LEVEL_INFO  Informational level
LEVEL_NOTICE  Notice level
LEVEL_WARN  Warning level
LEVEL_ERROR  Error level
LEVEL_CRIT  Critical messages level
LEVEL_ALERT  Alert level
LEVEL_EMERG  Emergency messages level
LEVEL_NOLEVEL  No level (line is logged)

Definition at line 45 of file logger.hpp.

enum uStreamLib::Logger::LoggerMode
 

Logger modes.

Enumeration values:
MODE_FORCE  Write messages when requested
MODE_DEFER  Write messages when possible

Definition at line 35 of file logger.hpp.

int32 uStreamLib::Logger::init (  char *  name  ) 
 

Initialize logger. Each logger as its own name (which is NOT a filename). Logger name is used to have multiple loggers registred into an application, so that application modules can switch among loggers.

Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if out of memory.

Reimplemented in uStreamLib::LoggerStdOut.

Definition at line 39 of file logger.cpp.
